page.title: 17Plains Farm Primary School
page.content: { Plains Farm School}was first built after the second world war. It was a temporary building which closed down and was relaced by the present brick building in 1977. There are two hundred children in the{infant}and {juniors}department and sixty children visit the{nursery school}which is in a separate building but in the same grounds. Thirty children attend the nursery school in the morning and another thirty in the afternoon. The School has{two halls,}one used for P E. (The apparatus was laid out when we visited.) Each unit of the building has it's own activity area and library. They have only one {football team}and the{Parents' {Association}helps with the{Badminton {team.}The playing fields are very large and the school gardens were very well laid out.{
